data.title: Complete list of PSP/minis/PSone games playable on Vita
data.meta_description: Thanks to the folks at NeoGaf (PSP), NeoGaf (PSone), Sony, and players like you, we have a list of digital PSP and minis games playable on the Vita. This...
data.text:
Thanks to the folks at NeoGaf (PSP), NeoGaf (PSone), Sony, and players like you, we have a list of digital PSP and minis games playable on the Vita. This list is ongoing and will be edited whenever new discoveries are found. Despite what the time stamp below this post says, this list is updated every week when the PS Store is updated.

EDIT from Tizoc: Do note that the list below is for US PSN games only atm, feel free to post or add a list of what PSP or PSX are and are not compatible with an EU Account Vita as a 4th list.

Updates to this list were added based on information found in these 2 websites:

http://www.snapturtle.com/wp/2012/03/02/psp-titles-playable-on-ps-vita/

www.giantbomb.com

COLOR KEY

Green = These games can be downloaded directly to the Vita via the online store.

Blue = Discovered by users. Download these to the PS3 first then transfer to the Vita

Gray = Untested

Red = Does not work at this time.

Purple = Has been pulled from PSN and thus will likely not work on Vita in the future.

Compatible games on US PSN

PSP GAMES

101-in-1 Megamix

2010 FIFA World Cup South Africa

[quote name='coolz481']How much better do PSP games look and run on the Vita? There's a comparison shot on neogaf, but I can't really tell as it's zoomed in quite a bit.[/QUOTE]

They run much faster because of the Vita's improved speeds. Games have almost no loading times even games with notorious bad loading times like Burnout Legends, GTA: Vice City Stories, Peace Walker all have loading times of a few seconds. The saving is also much faster now.

Add that to the bigger screen and the ability to use the right stick in games, where Peace Walker (see my thread) benefit tremendously and I've had a rebirth in PSP gaming. I've actually been playing GoW: Ghost of Sparta more then Uncharted: Golden Abyss and finally downloaded FF IV and The 3rd Birthday.

[quote name='daveyd']Probably not a very noticeable improvement, but you do get to play them on a slightly larger screen According to this, the PSVita can do bilinear filtering for the PSP games, which helps smooth out rough edges, much like anti-aliasing.[/QUOTE]

Bilinear Filtering does smooth out the jaggies in games though. I've been playing GoW: Ghost of Sparta and I don't like the blur it adds. Then again on Burnout Legends I do like it. I tend to try it in each game and see what effect it adds, but most cases I just turn it off.

I think the biggest improvement is the bigger screen.

[quote name='JohnHarker']Does this mean I have to re-download the games? I got LBP and Super Stardust in the security snafu and never got around to installing it on my PSP. They don't show up when I connect the vita.[/QUOTE]

If they're not available on the PSN Vita store, then you can re-download them on the PS3 and install them that way.

I downloaded most of my PSP games and tried to install them that way last week when I was trying to see which ones were playable or not.

[quote name='freddyfromutah']Hold down the PS button during the game, and then turn on bilinear filtering

Sad to see Final Fantasy Tactics not listed on either.[/QUOTE]

You actually hold down on the touchscreen for a few seconds.

Final Fantasy Tactics is playable. You can grab it directly from the Vita PSN store.

[quote name='finsfan0210']Awesome. Installing LBP and Killzone Liberation now. Wonder if Pinball Heroes will work? (From the Uncharted 2 GOTY voucher)[/QUOTE]

Yes. All 4 Pinball Heroes tables work.
